Articles.Content:
Hello,

I'm getting a new PC and I want to have KSP on it. But the problem is how do I transfer my saved progress in KSP to another PC. The computer i'm using now uses windows 7 but the new computer will use windows 10. (Also I am using Steam to play KSP).

Edited July 20, 2019 by arqfrizzen
Forgot part of the question.

It's actually really easy. The easiest way of all is just to store the KSP home directory and everything below it onto a USB stick, move the USB stick to the other computer, and copy the whole thing anywhere you like on the new computer.

There is no specific directory requirement. There is no specific DRM requirement.

In fact, it's best if you play KSP from a directory that is not the default Steam download directory. That way, the Steam directory is always a pure vanilla copy, if you ever need to fall back to a pure vanilla copy of the game.

You current progress is stored in the persistent.sfs file in the KerbalSpaceProgram/saves/gamename directory. If you just copy that one file, you can move your current progress to any computer with a compatible version of KSP (including any necessary mods).
